author: Richard Barley
title: What to Watch in Markets? Hint: It Isn’t Just Stocks
text:
When markets are in turmoil, there are lots of moving parts for investors to track. The drama is clear in equities: the S&P 500 is down more than 10% from its peak, and the VIX stock-volatility index has shot higher. But investors shouldn’t ignore less drastic moves elsewhere.
Two things in particular stand out: the U.S. dollar and credit markets. The greenback has gained modestly, with the ICE U.S. dollar index up 1.8% from the low reached at the start of February. And credit markets have appeared resilient in the face... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
